intro: Meliosma dives, commonly known as the smoothleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 feet. The plant features heart-shaped, smooth leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its showy, pinkish-white flowers bloom in the summer and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Meliosma dives is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
